message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about compasses and their purpose. A compass is a navigational tool that is used to determine orientation and direction. It works based on the Earth's magnetic field, which allows the needle of the compass to point towards the North Pole. Option (B) is incorrect because a compass does not track people. Option (C) is unrelated to the function of a compass. Option (D) is incorrect because the compass was invented much earlier than 1905.

This question requires knowledge about what a compass does. A compass is a tool that determines orientation and direction. It uses Earth's magnetic field to align itself with the North and South poles, allowing users to determine which way is North. Option (B) is incorrect because a compass does not track people. Option (C) is incorrect because a compass is not used for cleaning. Option (D) is incorrect because the invention of the compass dates back much earlier, to around 206 BC in ancient China.

It "knows" or indicates orientation by pointing towards the magnetic North Pole. Option (B) is incorrect because a compass does not track people. Option (C) is unrelated to the function of a compass. Option (D) is incorrect because compasses have been used since ancient times for navigation and were not invented in 1905.
